## Summary

Interactive maps can be built using the R package Leaflet. Main details about houses at sale located in Buenos Aires, Argentina are shown in a OpenStreetMap interactive map after processing a data set provided by [Properati](https://www.properati.com.ar/data/). Code is available in [this](https://github.com/ricardoleoncorreia/data-science-portfolio) GitHub repository.

## Data preprocess criteria

Houses shown satisfy the following conditions:

* **Location:** Capital of Argentina.
* **Property type:** House.
* **Total surface (m<sup>2</sup>):** Between 15 and 500.
* **Number of rooms:** 4.
* **Number of bathrooms:** 2.
* **Prices (USD):** Between 200,000 and 2,000,000.

## Interactive map

```{r message=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
library(leaflet)
dataset <- read.csv('dataset.csv')
legend_labels <- c('price < 200,000', '200,000 < price < 1,000,000', 'price > 1,000,000')
legend_colors <- c('red', 'blue', 'green')
legend_title <- 'Price levels'
dataset %>%
    leaflet() %>%
    addTiles() %>%
    addLegend(labels=legend_labels, colors=legend_colors, title=legend_title) %>%
    addCircleMarkers(clusterOptions=markerClusterOptions(),
                     popup = dataset$description,
                     color = dataset$price_level)
```
